intro: Knautia drymeja, commonly known as the alpine knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its fluffy, pink or purple flower heads that resemble small clouds. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Knautia drymeja is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
